title: Siblings Abroad
opening: Lyn takes her leave of Araphen, finding no aid from its spiteful marquess. Now, she and her companions resume their march toward Caelin in earnest. Racing against time, with her grandfather's life the prize. Harried and impatient, Lyn presses onward. Suddenly a young boy appears and pleads for their assistance.

intro.speaker: Nils
intro.line: Please! Somebody... Somebody, please help!

intro.speaker: Innkeeper
intro.line: That's enough! Get out now! I want none of your trouble!

intro.speaker: Nils
intro.line: But, sir... Why? You were so kind yesterday...

intro.speaker: Innkeeper
intro.line: I thought you were just two kids, a couple of traveling performers... If those men are chasing you, you must be up to no good! Now get up and get out! You're a plague on decent folk!

intro.speaker: Inkeeper
intro.line: Whew... What a mess.

intro.speaker: Lucius
intro.line: Hmmm...

intro.speaker: Lyn
intro.line: Where are we, Kent?

intro.speaker: Kent
intro.line: This is Kathelet. If we head due south, we'll pass into Caelin.

intro.speaker: Sain
intro.line: From here, I'd say we're about ten days' ride to Castle Caelin. Assuming we don't run into any delays, of course.

intro.speaker: Lyn
intro.line: Ten days...

intro.speaker: Nils
intro.line: Pardon me, but...

intro.speaker: Lyn
intro.line: Yes? Can I help you?

intro.speaker: Nils
intro.line: You and your friends... Are you mercenaries?

intro.speaker: Lyn
intro.line: And if we are?

intro.speaker: Nils
intro.line: I need your help!

intro.speaker: Kent
intro.line: Milady Lyndis, you mustn't let your guard down. Not even for a child.

intro.speaker: Lyn
intro.line: I know. Forgive me, but we're in a hurry. Is there someone else you can ask?

intro.speaker: Nils
intro.line: There's no time! Ninian's been... It's my sister! Some men have taken her away!

intro.speaker: Sain
intro.line: Your sister? Did you say your sister's been accosted?

intro.speaker: Kent
intro.line: Sain...

intro.speaker: Nils
intro.line: That's right! By some cruel, awful men. I don't know what I'll do without Ninian.

intro.speaker: Sain
intro.line: Milady Lyndis! We must help him!

intro.speaker: Kent
intro.line: Nonsense! We haven't the time! If the marquess is as ill as we've heard, we must proceed!

intro.speaker: Lyn
intro.line: Kent, I... I want to help this child.

intro.speaker: Kent
intro.line: Milady?

intro.speaker: Lyn
intro.line: I'm worried about my grandfather, of course. But this! I cannot stand by and let a child be taken from her home!

intro.speaker: Kent
intro.line: I see...

intro.speaker: Lyn
intro.line: I'm sorry, Kent.

intro.speaker: Kent
intro.line: I am your loyal retainer. You owe me no apologies. You must do as your heart dictates, milady. I will follow you, no matter where that may lead.

intro.speaker: Lyn
intro.line: Thank you.

intro.speaker: Sain
intro.line: Hah! Such a noble speech! Ever the true knight, that one! Ah, well. You're in luck, laddie! Let's go get your sister!

intro.speaker: Lyn
intro.line: Will you lead us to the men who've done this?

intro.speaker: Nils
intro.line: Uh huh. They're really tough, so be careful.

intro.speaker: Lyn
intro.line: Leave them to us. We're pretty tough ourselves. Right, Mark?

intro.speaker: Nils
intro.line: Ah! Oh, no...

intro.speaker: Ruffian
intro.line: Heh heh heh... Found him! C'mon, it's back to Nergal with you. Quiet now.

intro.speaker: Nils
intro.line: No! Let Ninian go!

intro.speaker: Ruffian
intro.line: We ain't supposed to kill you, but we sure can rough you up! Get 'em!

intro.speaker: Ruffian
intro.line: Huh? Who do you think you are?

intro.speaker: Nils
intro.line: Lyn!

intro.speaker: Lyn
intro.line: Let the boy's sister go.

intro.speaker: Ruffian
intro.line: Ah... So you want to help the kid, huh? What a shame. You're gonna die for something that don't concern you.

intro.speaker: Lyn
intro.line: You think so, do you? Do we look so meek to you? I think you're in for a terrible shock!

intro.speaker: Ruffian
intro.line: Stupid girl... You'll regret those words. Take 'em down, boys!

battle.speaker: In-Game Message
battle.line: Starting with this chapter, you'll be able to use the preparations screen. On this screen, you can choose who will fight, equip different items, and arrange your formation, among other things. If you have no special preparations to make, simply press START. This starts the chapter with the same group you were using at the end of the last chapter.

battle.speaker: Lyn
battle.line: I see we're facing a shaman, Mark. I've heard that practitioners of the dark arts are fearsome foes. We'll have to be careful... What!? Who are you?

battle.speaker: Lucius
battle.line: Please forgive me. I never meant to startle you.

battle.speaker: Lyn
battle.line: Your robes... They look like religious vestiary. Are you an Elimine bishop?

battle.speaker: Lucius
battle.line: Yes... Well, no. I'm only an acolyte, an Elimine monk, to be specific. My name's Lucius.

battle.speaker: Lyn
battle.line: Do you have business with us?

battle.speaker: Lucius
battle.line: I was at the inn when this child came seeking help. The innkeeper was afraid to get involved. He was...unpleasant.

battle.speaker: Nils
battle.line: I wasn't afraid of him! I'm used to being treated that way.

battle.speaker: Lyn
battle.line: That's awful.

battle.speaker: Lucius
battle.line: May I please lend you my services? I truly wish to help the boy. If only a little.

battle.speaker: Lyn
battle.line: Of course.

battle.speaker: Lucius
battle.line: Thank you very much. The blessings of St. Elimine be upon you.

battle.speaker: Tutorial
battle.line: The monk Lucius has joined your group. Monks are users of the magic of light. Whose who wield magic are highly attuned to its flow, so they have a high magic resistance. Units with high magic resistances can reduce the damage caused by magical attacks. When magic users battle each other, they often find it hard to inflict damage. The light magic of monks is strong against the dark magic favored by shamans. Lucius should come in handy here. Let's put his magic to the test. Have Lucius attack the shaman nearest him.

battle.speaker: Lucius
battle.line: Mark, isn't it? I am Lucius. I await your orders.

battle.speaker: Lucius
battle.line: You wish for me to attack the shaman? Very well.

battle.speaker: Lucius
battle.line: I beg your pardon, but I would prefer to attack from here.

battle.speaker: Nils
battle.line: I can help, too!

battle.speaker: Lyn
battle.line: Nils! Can you fight?

battle.speaker: Nils
battle.line: No... But I'm a bard, and bards are useful to have around!

battle.speaker: Lyn
battle.line: A bard? Do you mean you're a minstrel? This is no place for a ballad or a saltarello.

battle.speaker: Nils
battle.line: C'mon, trust me! I'm all yours, Mark.

battle.speaker: Tutorial
battle.line: It's time to see what Nils can do. The music played by bards allows your allies to move twice in the same turn. However, bards cannot engage in combat, so be careful not to expose them to danger.

battle.speaker: Nils
battle.line: Mark? I'm Nils! I'd like to perform for youm so give the word.

battle.speaker: Nils
battle.line: You'd like me to play for Lucius, right?

battle.speaker: Nils
battle.line: I have to be next to him, so he can hear my tune!

battle.speaker: Nils
battle.line: What do you think?

battle.speaker: Lyn
battle.line: That was lovely... invigorating, even. You ought to play for me sometime. I could use the boost!

battle.speaker: Nils
battle.line: Everyone could! My music can refresh you all!

battle.speaker: Tutorial
battle.line: Through the power of Nils's music, Lucius can move again this turn. Bards gain experience by playing music. Use Nils's powers often, and increase his skill.

visit.speaker: Girl
visit.line: Hmmm... Maybe I could get some firewood out of it... Hm? Who's there? Who are you? Ah, you're just passing through? Pay me no mind. I was just thinking out loud. You see, there's an old tree on the other side of this mountain. It's just a dead old snag, really. I was just thinking of some way I could put it to good use. As I said, it's nothing that need concern you.

visit.speaker: Innkeeper
visit.line: That's quite a group you've gotten yourself involved with. You do know you're facing the Black Fang, right? Anyone they target winds up... Well, you know. No one escapes the Fang! That's what they say, anyway. You and those odd children? I'd say you're finished. Not that I'll have any part of it. Course not!

visit.speaker: Hector
visit.line: Blast! Eliwood's late. I wonder what's keeping him... ...Starting to think my axe'll rust over before he finds his way here.

visit.speaker: Serra
visit.line: Excuse me! Is anyone home? An empty house... how dull!

visit.speaker: Hector
visit.line: Whew... I thought she would find me for sure. She's been working for my brother in Bern. And now she's returned... Ahh...

visit.speaker: Matthew
visit.line: Huh? Milord! What brings you here?

visit.speaker: Hector
visit.line: Ah, Matthew. Eliwood and I are here for our monthly bout.

visit.speaker: Matthew
visit.line: You're still testing one another's fighting prowess, eh? It's a solid friendship you two share, that you can practice so faithfully.

visit.speaker: Hector
visit.line: If you don't sharpen your blade, you lose your edge. So tell me, what are you doing here?

visit.speaker: Matthew
visit.line: Milord Uther was curious about the succession issue here.

visit.speaker: Hector
visit.line: Oh, the long-lost granddaughter thing, right? So which way does my brother lean?

visit.speaker: Matthew
visit.line: By my assessment, he will back the granddaughter's claim. The marquess's brother, Lundgren, is too ambitious by far. Left alone, we might wake to find him at Ostia's door before long.

visit.speaker: Matthew
visit.line: My return to Ostia is going to be delayed a bit. Would you mind letting Lord Uther know?

visit.speaker: Hector
visit.line: What? So the marquess's brother is now your personal messenger?

visit.speaker: Matthew
visit.line: You always did have a good sense of humor, milord. Don't forget my message!

visit.speaker: Villager
visit.line: So how much do you know about magic, huh? Magical attacks are special. You can't just avoid 'em like a sword or an axe. Not even if you're wearing armor. Who's tough against magic? Let me think... Well, anyone who uses magic or staves. Pegasus knights, too. Hm? You got others who need to battle magic users? I got something for 'em. It's a special kind of water. "Pure water," it's called. Just sprinkle a bit on you. It'll protect you and lessen the damage you take a bit. Go on, take it. Don't be so shy. It'snot like I'm givin' you gold or anything. This stuff's strongest when you first put it on. It gets weaker as time passes, so be careful.

boss.speaker: Heintz
boss.line: Who are you supposed to be? Playing the heroes in some foolish knightly romance? You may think you're helping the children, but you're only rushing to your doom!

boss.speaker: Heintz
boss.line: You were only... striking at air... You are...too late. The girl is already--

end.speaker: Lyn
end.line: Nils! Where's your sister?

end.speaker: Nils
end.line: Ninian! Ninian... She's not here. Why? Where could she be?

end.speaker: Kent
end.line: My lady Lyndis! A villager spotted a group of men riding south.

end.speaker: Sain
end.line: The boy's dear sister... They must have her!

end.speaker: Lyn
end.line: Come! We must give chase!

end.speaker: Nils
end.line: But... But... We won't make it! What if they've already...
Are you looking for this girl here?

end.speaker: Nils
end.line: Ninian! Ninian!

end.speaker: Eliwood
end.line: She'll be fine. She's just lost consciousness.

end.speaker: Lyn
end.line: Who are you?

end.speaker: Eliwood
end.line: I'm Eliwood, of Pherae. My father os the marquess.

end.speaker: Lyn
end.line: The marquess's son...

end.speaker: Eliwood
end.line: She was with a band of ruffians. She seemed upset. She looked in need of rescuing... Was I wrong to involve myself?

end.speaker: Lyn
end.line: No, you saved her life. Thank you. My name is Lyn. I'm from Sacae. I'm Marquess Caelin's granddaughter.

end.speaker: Eliwood
end.line: Marquess Caelin?

end.speaker: Lyn
end.line: And that's my story. It's not an easy tale to believe, I know...

end.speaker: Eliwood
end.line: No, I do believe you.

end.speaker: Lyn
end.line: What?

end.speaker: Eliwood
end.line: At first glance, all I saw was a daughter of the plainsfolk. Now I can see it, though. You have your grandfather's eyes.

end.speaker: Lyn
end.line: Do you know my grandfather?

end.speaker: Eliwood
end.line: The marquess, Lord Hausen, is my father's good friend. I also know that the proud people of Sacae tell no lies. It's true, isn't it?

end.speaker: Lyn
end.line: Yes... Thank you. I would not have expected any Lycian noble to be so courteous to a Sacaean nomad.

end.speaker: Eliwood
end.line: You seemed to be in trouble. May I be of assistance?

end.speaker: Lyn
end.line: Thank you for your kind offer. This is my problem, though, and I'll deal with it.

end.speaker: Eliwood
end.line: I see. I'll be in the area for a few days longer. If you need anything, please let me know. Lyndis, I'm on your side.

end.speaker: Lyn
end.line: Eliwood... Thank you.

end.speaker: Nils
end.line: Ninian! Are you awake?

end.speaker: Ninian
end.line: Nils? Is it really you? Oh, you're safe!

end.speaker: Nils
end.line: Uh-huh. These people helped me.

end.speaker: Ninian
end.line: Who are they?

end.speaker: Nils
end.line: Uh...

end.speaker: Lyn
end.line: I'm Lyn. I'm glad you're feeling better.

end.speaker: Ninian
end.line: Milady Lyn... Thank you. I'm called Ninian. My brother, Nils, and I are traveling performers.

end.speaker: Lyn
end.line: Both of you? Your borther's a musician. How about you, Ninian?

end.speaker: Ninian
end.line: I... I dance.

end.speaker: Sain
end.line: What? Oh my... you're a dancer!

end.speaker: Lyn
end.line: Sain... Later, please.

end.speaker: Sain
end.line: Um, yeah. Of course.

end.speaker: Lyn
end.line: A dancer? Your clothes don't look like those of a dancer.

end.speaker: Nils
end.line: Ninian dances to honor life. It's special... Sacred.

end.speaker: Lyn
end.line: A sacred dance? What does that mean?

end.speaker: Ninian
end.line: I... The dance I perform when we travel is just a normal dance. My other dance, though... When they caught me, I twisted my ankle. I cannot dance to aid you... I'm sorry.

end.speaker: Lyn
end.line: Please don't worry. We're just happy to see that you're out of harm's way.

end.speaker: Ninian
end.line: Thank you.

end.speaker: Lyn
end.line: But I am concerned about your leg. You can't travel on it...

end.speaker: Nils
end.line: I've an idea. Would it be too much to ask that we travel with you?

end.speaker: Lyn
end.line: I can't allow that! It's far too dangerous. We're being hunted. We never know when we're going to be attacked.

end.speaker: Nils
end.line: We wouldn't be a hinderance. We could even help you. Right, Ninian?

end.speaker: Ninian
end.line: Yes. We might be able to repay our debt using our...special talents.

end.speaker: Lyn
end.line: Special abilities?

end.speaker: Ninian
end.line: When something poses a threat to us, we can sense its approach.

end.speaker: Lyn
end.line: Truly? That's amazing!

end.speaker: Nils
end.line: We can feel it coming, but we can't do anything to stop it. You're warriors, though, so you don't have that worry.

end.speaker: Lyn
end.line: What do you think, Kent?

end.speaker: Kent
end.line: I think leaving them here would cause Lady Lyndis more worry than having them travel with us.

end.speaker: Lyn
end.line: Sain? Oh, never mind. I know what your answer is. Do you really want to travel with us?

end.speaker: Nils
end.line: Of course!

end.speaker: Ninian
end.line: You have our gratitude, milady.

end.speaker: Ninian
end.line: Oh...

end.speaker: Nils
end.line: What's wrong, Ninian?

end.speaker: Ninian
end.line: I've lost my ring.

end.speaker: Lyn
end.line: Your ring?

end.speaker: Nils
end.line: Not Ninis' Grace?

end.speaker: Ninian
end.line: The very one.

end.speaker: Nils
end.line: They stole it? Those curs!!!

end.speaker: Lyn
end.line: Was it valuable?

end.speaker: Ninian
end.line: It was a keepsake from our departed mother.

end.speaker: Nils
end.line: It was blessed by the spirit of Ninis... There's no other like it in the world. And now we have lost it to those villains. There's nothing we can do.

end.speaker: Ninian
end.line: You're right.

end.speaker: Lyn
end.line: Can I talk to you, Mark? You heard all of that, right? What do you think? I'd really love to retrieve Ninian's ring for her. But if Nils is right, those thieves might prove to be too strong for us. What should we do?

end.speaker: Tutorial
end.line: When you fulfill certain conditions, side quests may make themselves apparent to you. Side quests allow you to learn things that aren't part of the main story. You might meet tough new enemies or find new companions to travel with. However, side quests are very difficult, and once you begin one, you must see it through to its end. If you plan to challenge a side quest, I suggest you keep the save data from the previous mission. Not accepting side quests will not effect your ranking. If you're in a hurry to pursue the main story, skip the side quests.

end.speaker: Lyn
end.line: You want to help them? That's great! I was hoping you'd say that, Mark. Kent! Sain! Those men were headed south. We must give pursuit!

end.speaker: Sain
end.line: On your word, milady!

end.speaker: Lyn
end.line: There's no turning back now. Let's ride!
